title: E field - field lines from charge Q inside shell

content.question: A small conducting sphere with a positive net charge <math alttext="positive Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mpadded></math> is located within a spherical conducting shell that is electrically neutral. The figure shows a cross-sectional view of the small sphere and the shell, where the sphere is to the right of the center of the shell. Which of the following diagrams of electric field lines best represents the electric field inside the spherical shell?

choices.label: The figure shows the original cross-sectional view of a small sphere to the right of center inside a spherical shell, but with 8 electric field lines directed from the outer surface of the sphere to the inner surface of the shell. The electric field lines are straight. All lines are at right angles to the surface of the sphere. One goes horizontally to the right. One goes upward and to the right. One goes vertically upward. One goes upward and to the left. One goes horizontally to the left. One goes downward and to the left. One goes vertically downward. One goes downward and to the right.

The figure shows the original cross-sectional view of a small sphere to the right of center inside a spherical shell, but with 8 electric field lines directed from the outer surface of the sphere to the inner surface of the shell. The electric field lines are straight. The angles between the lines and the surface of the sphere vary depending on the starting point. One goes horizontally to the right. One goes upward and to the right. Two go upward and to the left. One goes horizontally to the left. Two go downward and to the left. One goes downward and to the right.

The figure shows the original cross-sectional view of a small sphere to the right of center inside a spherical shell, but with 8 electric field lines directed from the outer surface of the sphere to the inner surface of the shell. Two of the electric field lines are straight and six are curved, all of them concave to the right. All lines are perpendicular to both surfaces. The two straight lines are horizontal, one going to the right and one going to the left. Two curved electric field lines go upward and to the right. One curved electric field line goes upward and to the left. Two curved electric field lines go downward and to the right. One curved electric field line goes downward and to the left.

Two of the electric field lines are straight and six are curved, all of them concave to the left. All lines are perpendicular to the surface of the sphere, but only the straight lines are perpendicular to the inside surface of the shell. The two straight lines are horizontal, one going to the right and one going to the left. One curved electric field line goes upward and to the right. Two curved electric field lines go upward and to the left. One curved electric field line goes downward and to the right. Two curved electric field lines go downward and to the left.
